body: Can we just replace `*` with all column of table ?

Which step should we replace?
I think it's hard to replace `*` with all columns.

If the we can get `TableMetaData`, encryptor may calculate the owner table.

I have a crazy idea, maybe it's unfeasible.
We can generate aliases for columns in DQL like [Hibernate](https://docs.jboss.org/hibernate/orm/5.4/userguide/html_single/Hibernate_User_Guide.html#sql-multi-entity-query). 
If user send an sql like `SELECT order_id from t_order`, we generate an alias for `order_id`, like `t_order_order_id_123` and send the new sql `SELECT order_id AS t_order_order_id_123 from t_order` to DB. We can exactly get owner table by column name, Because alias is we generated.
In this case, we can replace `i.*` with `order_item_id AS t_order_item_order_item_id_, order_id AS t_order_item_order_id_, user_id  AS t_order_item_user_id_, status AS t_order_item_status_`.

Is  my  way  wrong?

I've tested it. No problem.

There are two questions for your idea.

1. We need to do much work to make sure the rewrite SQL is correct. Hibernate can do this because it generate SQL from JavaBean not SQL. But SS focus on SQL, SS need to parse logicSQL, and then rewrite.
2. Even we do rewrite for SQL, how to deal with this kind of situation that logic SQL has origin column alias like `select i.status as i_status, o.status as o_status from t_order i, t_order_item o`?
@mygitdds , `saga.properties` should be located in root classpath. I am not clear for your environment, So I think that your `saga.properties` file is it in the wrong place.

I have added test case about the modified class files. But Coverage still decreased.

The `org.apache.shardingsphere.shardingjdbc.spring.boot.SpringBootConfiguration` case this problem, but I don't modified this file.

and how to increase the coverage?

> @KomachiSion The saga of version 4.0.0-rc2 that I used has many similar situations on Baidu, because after the project is packaged into jar package, the path cannot be obtained.

You can try add `saga.properties` to classpath by `-classpath` java properties like 

`java -classpath .:${yourClassPath}:${saga.propertiesPath} ${MAINCLASS}`

> ink this is due to your shardi

Thanks for your reply. How can I config to make Shardingsphere send only 3 query requests?  The data locates in three certain tables, it's useless to send extra 6 query requests to DB which does not contain data. BTW, I shard my data into 100 DBs * 10 Tables, it costs serious problem in my situation
Closed for not change title
Closed for not change title

https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/en/features/sharding/principle/route/
However, Shardingsphere  document says if SQL is
`
SELECT * FROM t_order WHERE order_id IN (1, 2);
`
The route result will be:
`
SELECT * FROM t_order_0 WHERE order_id IN (1, 2);
SELECT * FROM t_order_1 WHERE order_id IN (1, 2);
`
The original logical SQL is split into 2 query requests instead of 4 query requests as above.

So I am quite wondering if I am wrong with config or this is a BUG or this is a designed feature?

> @huangjian888 @wgy8283335 @dongzl Hi, as distributed lock is necessary for Leaf-KeyGenerator, it appears that we would take time to get on with Nacos.
